title: 'It's so f******* cold in here!'' Hilarious moment BBC Radio 4 interrupted by presenter
text:
Flagship BBC Radio 4 show You and Yours, presented by Winifred Robinson (above) was interrupted by another presenter complaining that a neighbouring studio was ‘f***** cold’ - live on air

This is the hilarious moment a flagship BBC Radio 4 show was interrupted live on air by another presenter complaining a neighbouring studio was ‘f***** cold’.

The foul-mouth interruption came during Radio 4’s consumer show ‘You and Yours’ at lunch-time on Wednesday.

The broadcaster burst onto the airways while testing his own microphone from a separate studio, exclaiming; ‘It’s f****** cold in here – Jesus Christ it’s cold!’

The reporter – who the BBC have refused to identify - talked over the show for about four minutes before the technical glitch, that had allowed two emissions to be broadcast simultaneously, was brought to a halt.

You and Yours host Winifred could be heard interviewing a guest when a male voice suddenly interrupts the show starting; ‘Testing, testing, testing, testing.

He then goes onto comment about the temperature of the studio, remarking; ‘It’s f****** cold in here – Jesus Christ, it’s cold.’

The unidentified broadcaster burst onto the airways while testing his own microphone from a separate studio, exclaiming; ‘It’s f****** cold in here – Jesus Christ it’s cold!’

The broadcaster appeared to be giving a report about the British government’s response to Turkey’s invasion of Syria, before he was cut short.

You and Yours presenter Winifred Robinson later halted her own show to issue a humbling apology to listeners for the foul-mouthed outburst.

She said: ‘I’m told that there was some crossed lines at the start of the programme today and that you could hear someone swearing.

‘I’m really, really sorry about that.’

The foul-mouthed interruption has been deleted from the BBC’s online archive of the show.

But the unusual edition was recorded by listener Nigel Carr, who couldn't believe what he was hearing.

Another listener Martin Smith, 52, from north London, said: ‘I was just at home listening when I heard the cross over and herad a reporter using the ‘f-word’ live on radio before the watershed!

‘I thought it was quite funny, but very embarrassing for the corporation!’

The swearing interruption was also picked up by twitter users, who called for BBC ‘heads to roll’.

One posted: ‘Did someone just say ‘Jesus, it’s f****** cold in here #radio4’.

Another responded: ‘I wondered if it was just my radio ** I heard it too #radio4’

You and Yours presenter Winifred Robinson later halted her own show to issue a humbling apology to listeners for the foul-mouthed outburst

Some listeners joked that the BBC had been hijacked by climate protesters: ‘Don’t tell me XR [extinction rebellion] have invaded there too?’

A third wrote: ‘Extraordinary #radio4 double tracking cross-talk glitch during #youandyours. Heads must roll!’

One said: ‘Thought I was having an auditory hallucination **’

Another wrote: ‘I just heard that too. Don’t tell me XR [extinction rebellion] have invaded there too?’

The BBC have refused to comment about the gaff, saying host Winifred Robinson had ‘acknowledged’ the swearing.

A BBC spokesman said: ‘This is not a statement about this. It was acknowledged by the presenter on air.’
description: The foul-mouth interruption came during Radio 4's flagship consumer show 'You and Yours' at lunch-time on Wednesday.
